page.title: 15RECREATION -Sports,Pastimes
page.content: Brockenhurst Manor Golf Course is set amongst forest land; it is a Par 70 eighteen hole course consisting of two Par 5, twelve Par 4 and four Par 3 holes. Also in the grounds are a practice fairway, practice sheds, a nine hole putting green and a professional's shop. Dotted around the course are numerous bunkers, two lakes and streams which cross the fairways. Throughout the course a variety of wild life can seen- deer, squirrels, rabbits, snakes and a variety of bird life. The club's Professional is Clive Cargill who is retiring on 1st August 1985 after 37 years of service. A number of major tournaments are played at the Brockenhurst Manor Club including the Hampshire Championship and a Pro-Am Tournament.
